app.drawer.user.apikey.description:
Randomly generated password used in scripts to gain limited data access for any combination of reading, writing, and making changes to your user account (extended keys).

Can also be used by others to impersonate your account when only permitting read/write permissions.

documentation.open.actions: Actions are a feature in Howler that allow users to perform particular tasks on a large number of hits, through automating the execution of a task on each hit. Click for additional documentation.
documentation.open.search: Search allows you to query Howler and view the matching hits. Click for additional documentation.
documentation.open.templates: Howler allows analysts and detection engineers to create templates, which allow various analytics and their detections to present fields and data relevant to triaging alerts generated by that analytic/detection. Click for additional documentation.
documentation.open.views: Views are a feature in Howler that allow users to create custom, default queries through which they can organize and triage hits. Click for additional documentation.
duplicates.omitted: Some duplicate entries have been omitted.
features.warning.description: This feature is undergoing active development, and is not yet in a finished state. You may encounter bugs or instability. To report issues, reach out to APA2B in the Howler support channel.
features.warning.title: Feature In Active Development

hit.actions.conflict.assess: Someone else has already assessed this hit.
hit.actions.conflict.manage: Someone else has already interacted with this hit. Please try again.
hit.details.asessments.ambiguous.descrip: The nature of the hit was not successfully determined based on available data.
hit.details.asessments.attempt.descripti: The hit was part of a failed attempt to compromise.
hit.details.asessments.compromise.descri: The hit was part of a successful compromise.
hit.details.asessments.development.descr: The hit is related to development activity and should be ignored.
hit.details.asessments.false-positive.de: The hit is not related to the detection that created it.
hit.details.asessments.legitimate.descri: The hit represents legitimate activity not related to an incident.
hit.details.asessments.mitigated.descrip: This compromise has already been investigated, mitigated and reported on.
hit.details.asessments.recon.description: The hit is limited to reconnaissance activity.
hit.details.asessments.security.descript: The hit is related to internal cybersecurity activity and should be ignored.
hit.details.asessments.trivial.descripti: The hit was part of an incident of too low a severity to warrant a response.
hit.details.title: Details
hit.label: Labels
hit.label.category.assignments: Category: Assignments - Specifies what analyst or team of analysts is assigned to triaging this hit.
hit.label.category.campaign: Catergory: Campaign - Identifies ongoing campaigns from specific malware families or phishing initiatives. They should only be considered correct attributions if the hit is promoted to evidence.
hit.label.category.generic: Category: Generic - A catch-all for any labels added that don't match another category.
hit.label.category.insight: Category: Insight - An analyst has gained a useful insight that they are confident will remain true for future alerts if the surrounding circumstances remain the same.
hit.label.category.mitigation: Category: Mitigation - This label captures what efforts were undertaken to mitigate a compromise.
hit.label.category.operation: Category: Operation - The hit is related to an ongoing operation and should be scrutinized with special considerations and a broader understanding of the current circumstances.
hit.label.category.threat: Category: Threat - Identifies that the hit has been attributed to a known threat actor or group.
hit.label.category.tuning: Category: Tuning - Identifies which hits are already understood and should get triaged automatically.
hit.label.category.victim: Category: Victim - Hits produced from a victim notification stream can have a label that identifies the victim organization that needs to be notified.
hit.label.edit.add.label: New label value
hit.notebook.confirm.dialog: A notebook with that name already exists in your environment, do you wish to overwrite it?
hit.notebook.confirm.title: Overwrite existing notebook?
hit.notebook.error.failToPost: Failed to send notebook to Jupyterhub, make sure your user environment is running.
hit.overview.missing: No overview has been created for this hit. In order to create an overview, press the add button to the right.

page.dashboard.title: Dashboard
page.documentation.description.explanati: The documentation outlining what this endpoint is used for and how you should interact with it.
page.documentation.endpoint.explanation:
Endpoint Name - The user-friendly name of the endpoint
Endpoint Path - the path to make requests to in order to access this endpoint
Endpoint Stability - Whether this endpoint is safe to use and unlikely to change significantly.
Protection - Whether it is necessary to authenticate when accessing this endpoint
Methods - What HTTP methods can be used to access this endpoint
page.documentation.labels.name: Label Category
page.documentation.required_priv.explana: What privileges an API Key you generate must have to interact with this endpoint.
page.documentation.required_type.explana: Which user types have access to this endpoint. If any of the types are green, you have access to it.

page.settings.admin.title: Administration
page.settings.local.compact.json.descrip: Enable or disable a more compact JSON view, better suited to viewing lots of data at once.
page.settings.local.details.drawer: Always use drawer in Hit Search
page.settings.local.details.drawer.descr: Instead of switching between a divided view and the drawer on different screen sizes, this setting forces Howler to always use the drawer.
page.settings.local.flatten.json.descrip: Instead of showing the object structure of the JSON, show it as flattened keys.
page.settings.local.hits.layout.descript: This setting allows you to decide how much padding and spacing, as well as font size and element size, we use when rendering the UI. The denser the UI, the more data can be viewed.
page.settings.local.results.count.descri: How many results should we show per page when showing search results?
page.settings.local.search.width.descrip: The maximum size (in pixels) the results column in the search page.
page.settings.local.title: UI Preferences
page.settings.profile.table.groups.descr: This drawer will show you any groups howler sees you as a part of. This can be useful for verifying you have the permissions and roles you expect given your authentication method.
page.settings.profile.table.name: Name
page.settings.profile.title: Profile
page.settings.security.table.apiquota.de: This API quota manages the number of concurrent requests a user can make to howler. For high volume users, this may rate limit them and an administrator will need to change it to a higher number.
page.settings.security.title: User Security

route.advanced.query.lucene.description: Apache Lucence is a search syntax used by elasticsearch, Howler and apache lucene. See our documentation for information on this.
route.advanced.query.yaml.description: Sigma is a generic and open signature format that allows you to describe relevant log events in a straightforward manner. The rule format is very flexible, easy to write and applicable to any type of log file.

view.settings.advance_on_triage: Advance to next hit on triage
view.settings.advance_on_triage.descript: If this is enabled, triaging a hit on this view will automatically move to the next hit in line, making rapid triage of hits easier.
